national curriculum to be announced today. Education Secretary Michael Gove will launch his review of the national curriculum this morning with a clarion call for the restoration of "academic rigour" in state schools. The new national curriculum will therefore have a greater focus on subject content outlining the essential knowledge and understanding that pupils should be expected to have, says a background document of the new curriculum. In history, this will mean a move towards naming the individuals that pupils should learn about- such as Churchill, Nelson and Wellington. Traditionalists
